intro: Disporum xilingense, commonly known as the Xiling lily, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
